item.title: About
item.description: This blog is about the technique introduction of myvideoyun.com.

Collect Memory Usage of C/C++ executables on Ubuntu Concepts Heap: Stack RSS: Resident Set Size: the size of memory which are in RAM. It does not include memory which is swapped out. VSZ: Virtual memory size; Tools Top The top program provides a dynamic real-time view of a running system. It can display system summary information as well as a list of processes or threads currently being managed by the Linux kernel. It can display following fields: - %CPU: Cpu usage - %MEM: Memory Usage (RES), share of available phisical memory, its non-swapped phisical memory a task is using. - %DATA: Data + Stack Size (KiB), Data Resident Set size or DRS - SHR: Shared Meomory Size: The amount of shared memory available to a task, not all of which is typically resident. It simply reflects memory that could be potentially shared with other processes. - SWAP: Swapped Size: The non-resident portion of a task’s address space.
